question: When two aircraft are approaching head-on or approximately so and there is a danger of collision, each shall
answers: alter heading to the right.
alter heading to the left.
avoid the other by changing altitude.
turn on the anti-collision light.

question: When two aircraft are converging headings at approximately the same altitude, the aircraft that has the other on its right shall give way except that, gliders shall give way to
answers: rotary wing aircraft.
'heavy' aeroplanes.
airships.
balloons.

question: 'Controlled Airspace' means an airspace of defined dimensions within which
answers: aircraft must proceed in accordance with a SCATANA clearance.
an Air Traffic Control (ATC) service is provided.
only aircraft equipped with functioning two-way radio may operate.
Control is provided for instrument flight rules (IFR) traffic only.

question: Except for ultra-light aeroplanes, no person shall fly an aircraft in Canada unless
answers: it is registered.
there is in force with respect to aircraft a Certificate of Airworthiness or a Flight Permit.
its nationality and registration marks are affixed to the aircraft in a proper manner, and are clear and visible.
all of the above conditions are met.

question: No person shall attempt to fly as a flight crew member of a glider if
answers: less than five take-offs and landings have been completed in the preceding six months.
within the preceding 12 hours alcohol has been consumed.
experiencing a physical disability likely to prohibit immediate licence renewal.
less than five supervised take-offs and landings have been completed in the preceding six months.
